patterns: What are the requirements for BSc. Agricultural Engineering?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BSc. Agricultural Engineering programme?
Requirements for BSc. Agricultural Engineering programme?
What are the prerequisites for BSc. Agricultural Engineering?
BSc. Agricultural Engineering admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BSc. Agricultural Engineering programme?
What are the entry requirements for BSc. Agricultural Engineering programme?
Criteria for admission into BSc. Agricultural Engineering?
BSc. Agricultural Engineering programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Agricultural Engineering
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry.

    • Any of the following are acceptable in place of Chemistry; Technical Drawing or Engineering Science and General Agriculture, Biology, Metalwork, Auto Mechanics, Applied Electricity, and Building Construction.
      • Applicants in this category who do not have Chemistry must obtain Grade B3 in Integrated Science.

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Either credit passes in Pure Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, and Physics with an 'O' Level credit in Chemistry, OR Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application.
    • EITHER credit passes in Five (5) subjects at the 'O' Level including English Language, Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry, OR
    • Credit passes in THREE (3) WASSCE/SSSCE Core Subjects- English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science, and credit passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.

  • HND APPLICANTS
    • Admission would be based on assessment of Academic Transcript.
    • Applicants must satisfy the requirements for either WASSCE/SSSCE or 'A' Level as in (1.0) and (2.0) respectively.

patterns: cutoff points for BSc Agricultural Engineering
BSc Agricultural Engineering cutoff points

required score for BSc Agricultural Engineering
aggregate for BSc Agricultural Engineering
what is the cutoff for BSc Agricultural Engineering
cutoff marks for BSc Agricultural Engineering
BSc Agricultural Engineering required marks

score needed for BSc Agricultural Engineering
cutoff points for Agricultural Engineering
aggregate requirements for Agricultural Engineering
what were the cut-off aggregates for Agricultural Engineering
what are the cut-off aggregates Agricultural Engineering
responses: The cutoff points for BSc. Agricultural Engineering are typically around aggregate 16. Please check our website or contact the admissions office for the most up-to-date information, as cutoff points may vary each year.

responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Geomatic (Geodetic) Engineering
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry.

    • Geography is acceptable in place of Chemistry.
    • Any of the following are acceptable in place of Chemistry, Applied Electricity or Electronics.

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Either credit passes in Pure Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, and Physics with an 'O' Level credit in Chemistry, OR Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.

    • EITHER passes in Pure Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, and Physics with an 'O' Level credit pass in Chemistry OR Geography OR Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry or Geography.

  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application.
    • EITHER credit passes in Five (5) subjects at the 'O' Level including English Language, Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry, OR
    • Credit passes in THREE (3) WASSCE/SSSCE Core Subjects- English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science, and credit passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.
    • Geography is acceptable in place of Chemistry.

  • HND APPLICANTS
    • Admission would be based on assessment of Academic Transcript.
    • Applicants must satisfy the requirements for either WASSCE/SSSCE or 'A' Level as in (1.0) and (2.0) respectively.

responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Computer Engineering
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry.

    • Electricity/Applied Electricity or Electronics, or Information Communication Technology (ICT) is acceptable in place of Chemistry.

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Either credit passes in Pure Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, and Physics with an 'O' Level credit in Chemistry, OR Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.

    • Credit passes in THREE (3) WASSCE/SSSCE Core Subjects- English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science, and credit passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.

  • HND APPLICANTS
    • Applicants shall have at least Second Class Honours from any accredited Computer Engineering oriented programme such as Electrical and Electronic Engineering.
    • Admission would be based on assessment of Academic Transcript.
    • Applicants must satisfy the requirements for either WASSCE/SSSCE or 'A' Level as in (1.0) and (2.0) respectively.

  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry.

    • Electricity/Applied Electricity or Electronics, or Information Communication Technology (ICT) is acceptable in place of Chemistry.
    • Biology is acceptable in place of Chemistry.

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: Either credit passes in Pure Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, and Physics with an 'O' Level credit in Chemistry, OR Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of s the application.
    • EITHER credit passes in Five (5) subjects at the 'O' Level including English Language, Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry, OR
    • Credit passes in THREE (3) WASSCE/SSSCE Core Subjects- English Language, Mathematics and Integrated Science, and credit passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.

  • HND APPLICANTS
    • Applicants shall have at least Second Class Honours from any accredited Biomedical Engineering oriented programme such as Biomedical Engineering, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, and Medical Technology.
    • Admission would be based on assessment of Academic Transcript.
    • Applicants must satisfy the requirements for either WASSCE/SSSCE or 'A' Level as in (1.0) and (2.0) respectively.

patterns: What are the requirements for BSc. Automobile Engineering?
Can you provide the admission criteria for BSc. Automobile Engineering programme?
Requirements for BSc. Automobile Engineering programme?
What are the prerequisites for BSc. Automobile Engineering?
BSc. Automobile Engineering admission requirements?
Information on eligibility for BSc. Automobile Engineering programme?
What are the entry requirements for BSc. Automobile Engineering programme?
Criteria for admission into BSc. Automobile Engineering?
BSc. Automobile Engineering programme prerequisites?
responses:
Here are the requirements for BSc. Automobile Engineering
  • WASSCE/SSSCE APPLICANTS

    • Core Subjects: Credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science.

    Elective Subjects: Credit passes in Physics, Mathematics, and any one of the following:

    • Chemistry
    • Metalwork
    • Auto Mechanics
    • Applied Electricity
    • Technical Drawing
    • Building Construction
    • Woodwork

    Any of the following is acceptable in place of Chemistry; Metalwork, Auto Mechanics, Applied Electricity, Technical Drawing, Building Construction and Woodwork.

    Applicants without Chemistry shall obtain at least B3 in Integrated Science.

  • 'A' LEVEL APPLICANTS

    • 'O' Level: Credit passes in FIVE (5) subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and

    'A' Level or equivalent: At least credit passes in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.


  • MATURE APPLICANTS
    • Applicants must be 25 years at the time of the application.
    • A minimum of three (3) years of relevant working experience at the time of the application
    • Must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or A' Level or HND.

  • HND APPLICANTS
    • An applicants shall have at least Second Class Honour in any Mechanical Engineering orientated programme, such as:
      • Mechanical Engineering with any option
      • Agricultural Mechanization
      • Automobile Engineering
    • An Applicant must satisfy the requirements for WASSCE/SSSCE or 'O' Level.
    • Assessment shall be based on the applicants' transcripts.

  • INTERNATIONAL AND OTHER APPLICANTS
    • International Baccalaureate applicants may apply with contents of programmes equivalent to the Ghanaian WASSCE/SSSCE or the Ghanaian 'A' Level programmes.
    • Credit passes of International Baccalaureate applicants shall meet requirements 1.0 and 2.0 with equivalent certificates.
